intro: Chesniella gansuensis, commonly known as the Gansu chesniella, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Gansu Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
